message.content:
cs.NA, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.CE 

This paper deals with the problem of computing the trace of a matrix that is implicitly available through a function, which is a common problem in numerical analysis and machine learning. The paper proposes a new approach that exploits the pattern correlation between the diagonal of the inverse of the matrix and the diagonal of some approximate inverse that can be computed inexpensively. This approach involves various sampling and fitting techniques, which are commonly used in numerical analysis and machine learning. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.NA (Numerical Analysis), cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), and cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science).
